title: HTML hacks that shaped the Internet
dot:
digraph HTML_Hacks{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];Tedium[label="Today in Tedium
By Ernie @ Tedium"]; HTML_Hacks[label="HTML Hacks
(Unexpected Solutions for Web Design)"]; Netscape_Hack[label="1. Netscape Navigator 4.0 @import Hack
- Blocks off code to prevent layout issues"];Tables_Layout[label="2. Using HTML Tables for Layout
- Breaks conventions for better design"];Underscore_CSS[label="3. Underscore in CSS
- Targets IE6 for specific styling"];AlphaImageLoader[label="4. AlphaImageLoader for PNG Transparency
- Fixes transparency issues in IE"];Conditional_Comments[label="5. Conditional Comments
- Allows code execution for specific IE versions"];sIFR[label="6. Scalable Inman Flash Replacement (sIFR)
- Replaces fonts with Flash to enhance typography"];Preheader_Hack[label="7. Preheader Text Hack
- Improves email preview text visibility"];Chrome_Frame[label="8. Google Chrome Frame
- Replaces IE6 rendering with Chrome's engine"];Webkit_Selector[label="9. Webkit-only Selector Hack
- Targets Safari-specific CSS"];Responsive_Design[label="10. Responsive Design
- Adapts layouts for various screen sizes"];Tedium->HTML_Hacks;HTML_Hacks->Netscape_Hack;HTML_Hacks->Tables_Layout;HTML_Hacks->Underscore_CSS;HTML_Hacks->AlphaImageLoader;HTML_Hacks->Conditional_Comments;HTML_Hacks->sIFR;HTML_Hacks->Preheader_Hack;HTML_Hacks->Chrome_Frame;HTML_Hacks->Webkit_Selector;HTML_Hacks->Responsive_Design;subgraph cluster_hacks{label="Key Hacks";style=dashed;Netscape_Hack;Tables_Layout;Underscore_CSS;AlphaImageLoader;Conditional_Comments;sIFR;Preheader_Hack;Chrome_Frame;Webkit_Selector;Responsive_Design;}}

title: How to pick more beautiful colors for your data visualizations (2020)
dot:
digraph G{graph[charset="utf-8", rankdir=TB]; node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor="#f9f9f9", fontname="Arial", fontsize=12];edge[color="#888888", arrowhead=normal]; Title[label="Choosing Good Colors for Charts", shape=plaintext, fontsize=16, fontcolor="#333333"]; Start[label="Choosing good colors for your charts is hard.

(e.g., continents, industries, bird species)"]; Index[label="Index", shape=plaintext, fontsize=14, fontcolor="#333333"];Index00[label="00 Before we start..."];Index01[label="01 Broaden your understanding of colors"];Index02[label="02 Don’t dance all over the color wheel"];Index03[label="03 Use saturation and lightness to make your hues work"];Index04[label="04 Use warm colors & blue"];Index05[label="05 When using green, make it a yellow or blue one"];Index06[label="06 Avoid pure colors"];Index07[label="07 Avoid bright, saturated colors"];Index08[label="08 Combine colors with different lightness"];Index09[label="09 Make your colors equally “colorful”"];Index10[label="10 Avoid too little contrast with the background"];Index11[label="11 Avoid too much contrast with the background"];Index12[label="12 Choose a background that’s desaturated enough"];Index13[label="13 Copy colors, or understand them"]; BeforeStart[label="Before we start...
